definition: to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
sugar-coated bullets, term used by Mao (originally in 1949) to refer to corrupting bourgeois influences

sentences.english: Saab’s ARTHUR radar system locates incoming enemy projectiles and missiles.
sentences.chinese: ARTHUR雷达系统可定位敌方来袭炮弹和导弹。

sentences.english: The shell struck in the Abobo area.
The UNSC fleet MAC rounds impacted on the Covenant destroyer.
sentences.chinese: UNSC舰队的MAC炮弹冲击着圣约人的驱逐舰。

sentences.english: Twelve enemy transport aircraft on the handstand were knocked out by mortar shells.
sentences.chinese: 停机坪上的十二架敌方运输机被迫击炮弹击毁了。

sentences.english: A single, normal energy-projector shot could not by itself destroy a Covenant ship of war.
sentences.chinese: 单独的一发标准能量发射炮弹不可能摧毁一艘战舰。

sentences.english: The enemy's shells made great holes in the ranks .
sentences.chinese: 敌人的炮弹在士兵行列中炸成大洞。

sentences.english: While the insurgents were reloading their guns, the artillery-men were loading the cannon.
sentences.chinese: 当起义者重上子弹时，炮兵们也在上炮弹。

sentences.english: Yi exchange of information, to provide artillery shells hit flat.
sentences.chinese: 再主动找爆料天王邱毅交换情报，提供打扁炮弹。

sentences.english: The men in the trenches stayed down while the enemy shells were exploding.
sentences.chinese: 当友人的炮弹爆炸时，堑壕里的人坐倒了。

sentences.english: At that moment, shells began thudding a few hundred yards away.
sentences.chinese: 当时，炮弹在百余码外爆炸。

sentences.english: Our battery fired off many rounds of shot at the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 我们的炮兵连向敌人发射了许多发炮弹。

sentences.english: A shell covers the large-volume airbox located over the engine.
sentences.chinese: 一颗炮弹包括大批量进气箱设在引擎。

sentences.english: If you are forward of your position, the artillery will fall short.
sentences.chinese: 你的战位靠前时候，己方炮弹的射程就短了。

sentences.english: A few mortar shells were landing somewhere with a flat thudding sound.
sentences.chinese: 不知哪里落了几颗迫击炮弹，闷声闷气地轰轰几响。

sentences.english: Finally, the TGM with Combined Guidance are introduce.
sentences.chinese: 最后介绍采用复合制导体制的末制导炮弹。

sentences.english: How was the casing of the barricade going to behave under the cannon-balls?
sentences.chinese: 街垒的墙将怎样抵挡炮弹呢？

definition: big gun/cannon/artillery/one who talks big/trad. form 大炮 also used/CL:門|门[men2],尊[zun1]
